questions.question: Choose the correct word to complete the sentence: 'I ___ to the gym every morning.'
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'I' pairs with 'go' in the present tense.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. The subject 'I' requires the base form 'go'.
questions.explanation: The verb 'go' remains in its base form when used with the subject 'I'.

questions.question: Which sentence is grammatically correct?
answers: She have been working since morning.
She has been working since morning.
She had been working since morning.
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! This is the proper use of the present perfect continuous tense.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Remember the correct verb form for 'she'.
questions.explanation: Present perfect continuous ('has been working') is used to describe actions continuing from the past until now.
